oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Dubai Embraces Biodynamics
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Paull, John
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: "Organics" in general
Food systems
Knowledge management
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dubai is a city on the desert's edge. With an annual rainfall of 88 mm pa it is a city in perpetual drought. One consequence is that it imports nearly all of its food. Nils El Accad is the CEO of the region's largest organic retailer - Organic Foods and Cafe. It is a business with three organic supermarkets together with wholesale distribution in the region. Nils El Accad shares with John Paull his experiences and vision, and his enthusiasm for bio-dynamics which he regards as the "gold standard" for organics. Nils imports bio-dynamic produce from Egypt, South Africa and New Zealand, and certified organic food is sourced more widely.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Paull, John (2009) Dubai Embraces Biodynamics. Acres Australia, 17 (1), pp. 11-12.
